cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 40 mi (70 km) NE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island and 110 mi (175 km) ENE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift northwest today, then turn north near the Florida/Georgia coast and accelerate north-northeast parallel to the U.S. East Coast, passing just offshore of the Mid-Atlantic states before moving toward Atlantic Canada
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or over the Outer Banks of North Carolina

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from north of Deerfield Beach FL to Jupiter Inlet FL and from north of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to South Santee River SC; Tropical Storm Watch north of Golden Beach FL to Deerfield Beach FL and Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL; Tropical Storm Warning north of Deerfield Beach FL to Altamaha Sound GA; Storm Surge Warning Lantana FL to Savannah River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast, Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina, and portions of the Mid-Atlantic and southern New England coasts (including New Jersey) over the next 3–5 days
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤7%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds by late Friday into early Saturday; occasional gusty northeasterlies likely as the storm passes offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None anticipated for the Delaware River terminals; surge threat confined to the Southeast coast well south of New Jersey.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain associated with outer rain-bands could total 1–2 inches Friday–Saturday, below major-flood threshold.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and hazardous marine conditions could disrupt vessel scheduling along the New Jersey approaches.
